Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Hillary Clinton "handed over American uranium rights to the Russians," when in fact she was one of nine voting members who approved the uranium deal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the cited New York Times story does not actually state that Clinton "handed over" uranium rights to the Russians.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Clinton had the authority to unilaterally approve the uranium deal, when in reality it required approval from multiple entities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Clintons did not pocket money donated to the Clinton Foundation, as they made their money outside of office through speeches and books.
Understate: The claim understates the Clintons' estimated net worth, stating it as "hundreds of millions" when the cited article puts it at $110 million.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the donations to the Clinton Foundation, instead labeling them as coming from "criminals, dictators, countries that hate America," which is an oversimplification.
